3.42. 
Limitation period 
1. A spouse who has contracted a marriage under the age of eighteen years may seek a declaration of nullity of the marriage within the limitation period of one year from the date of his or her majority. 
2. An action for annulment of a marriage contracted without a true intention may be brought within a limitation period of one year from the date on which the circumstances giving rise to the annulment cease to exist or come to light. 
3. An action for the annulment of a marriage of convenience may be brought within one year from the date on which the marriage was celebrated. On the grounds set out in Article 3.39 of this Code, the public prosecutor may bring an action for annulment of a marriage within five years of the marriage being celebrated. 
4. Claims to declare marriage invalid on other grounds are not subject to the statute of limitations.
